verses.plain: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

tokens.t: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son
the heaviness of his mother.

verses.plain: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

tokens.t: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

verses.plain: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

tokens.t: The
will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.

verses.plain: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

tokens.t: He becometh poor that dealeth
a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

verses.plain: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

tokens.t: He that gathereth in summer
a wise son:
he that sleepeth in harvest
a son that causeth shame.

verses.plain: Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

tokens.t: Blessings
upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

verses.plain: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

tokens.t: The memory of the just
blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

verses.plain: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

tokens.t: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

verses.plain: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

tokens.t: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

verses.plain: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

tokens.t: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

verses.plain: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

tokens.t: The mouth of a righteous
a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

verses.plain: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.

tokens.t: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.

verses.plain: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

tokens.t: In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod
for the back of him that is void of understanding.

verses.plain: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.

tokens.t: Wise
lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish
near destruction.

verses.plain: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.

tokens.t: The rich man’s wealth
his strong city: the destruction of the poor
their poverty.

verses.plain: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

tokens.t: The labour of the righteous
to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

verses.plain: He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.

tokens.t: He
the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.

verses.plain: He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.

tokens.t: He that hideth hatred
lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander,
a fool.

verses.plain: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.

tokens.t: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips
wise.

verses.plain: The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.

tokens.t: The tongue of the just
choice silver: the heart of the wicked
little worth.

verses.plain: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.

tokens.t: The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.

verses.plain: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.

tokens.t: The blessing of the
, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.

verses.plain: It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.

tokens.t: as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.

verses.plain: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

tokens.t: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

verses.plain: As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

tokens.t: As the whirlwind passeth, so
the wicked no
but the righteous
an everlasting foundation.

verses.plain: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

tokens.t: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so
the sluggard to them that send him.

verses.plain: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

tokens.t: The fear of the
prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

verses.plain: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

tokens.t: The hope of the righteous
gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

verses.plain: The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.

tokens.t: The way of the
strength to the upright: but destruction
to the workers of iniquity.

verses.plain: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.

tokens.t: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.

verses.plain: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.

tokens.t: The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.

verses.plain: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.

tokens.t: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked
frowardness.

footnotes.text: the substance…: or, the wicked for their wickedness
a prating…: Heb. a fool of lips
